Present location: INSTITUT DE PAPYROLOGIE ET D'ÉGYPTOLOGIE, UNIVERSITÉ DE LILLE III [02/049] LILLE
Dating: 2ND INTERMEDIATE PERIOD (not after); MIDDLE KINGDOM (not before)
Name: Bowl
Description: Bowl with a small flat base, flared carinated body and a lip which thickens on the outside in continuation of the body, made from a fine, buff-coloured common clay which has been polished (but still bears traces of striations).  As was the custom during the Middle Kingdom and the beginning of the Second Intermediate Period, a stripe painted in red ochre adorns the exterior rim.
